reviews.text: The Garden Cafe is one of my favorite restaurants on the planet.  The decor is cozy and warm with a beautiful garden and a colorful colonial vibe. The food is outstanding and has great options for meat eaters and vegetarians,  alike. I greatly appreciate the social activism of the owners and know that the food is produced locally and the employees are treated with kindness and respect. ❤

Couple things. Our server spoke both English and Spanish and was super attentive..I had ordered a capuccino (so good!) and while I was drinking it, I said to my husband "I could drink 3 more of these." Our waiter had walked past at that moment and most likely heard me. I had finished that drink before the meal came and he saw my empty cup and offered to get me another...which was great since they didn't charge extra for it either. But really the decor is nice, a very relaxing place to eat breakfast. The quality of the food is good, nothing is particularly spicy, but there is always hot sauce on the table to amp up your meal! My husband really enjoyed the pancakes and the bacon was very good as well (ask for it well done)!

The garden Cafe is a restaurant and a boutique. It is located in a traditional colonial house of Granada. The attention to the client is excellent and the variety of the menu is good. I particularly like the selection of natural fruit juices. The boutique has a good variety of hand made products from Nicaragua. I appreciate that they sell products which profit goes to good causes.
Really nice place, some of the staff are friendlier than others but overall great experience. Excellent wifi too.
Beautiful green little Oasis with exzellent service and amazing food. If you like cheesy Quesedillas - and I mean really cheesy, this is the place to go to 😉

Nice and quiet place with AIR CONDITIONING room where you can chill and talk about business in a convivial environment with affordable price and friendly staff members and it is located in the most frequently use road the Prince Louis Rwagasore Chausee
The food is great
My favorite place to be in bujumbura. Nice atmosphere, nice food and nice juice too!!!
Nice place
Good Cafe centre with reasonable price and service

This is a very good place for a meal. Nicely decorated and clean. We did breakfast and everything was good. They have a lot of artesanal food here. The coffee is so good. I am attaching the menu for reference
Best place to eat in town. The chicken breast is amazing. Also the smoothies and pretty much everything else on the menu. Also very nice staff and owners! Love this place.
Lovely cafe. Had a great meal and enjoyed coffee and smoothies. Service was fantastic and so was the environment.
The best place in town for a cold healthy drink, great salad, sandwich or even sweey crepes!!

Little bit for everyone. From pasta to plain grill chicken. Little restaurant in the east side of La casada far from the buzzle.  Great affordable food . Nice court yard and friendly staff.. specify what you would like as appetizers tho if not they'll bring the food out all at once. Other than that great place been there a few times...

Way overpriced go to the calsada much better restaurants this place is a total ripoff,I went here in 2008 that was my review then, NOW ????
Stopped here for a quick late night beer and a listen to some live acoustic rock guitar [with loop pedal] - something I hadn't seen offered anywhere else. He was pretty entertaining.

Really good meat! Try the tenderloin beef with Gorgonzola sauce - it's fantastic! 

Of course it is not a very cheap restaurant, but the quality of food and the service is just exceptional compared to most nicaraguan places. It is also one of the few places I drink regulary red wine.

Giving them 1 star is alot. Horrible food for $120.00 USD?! Bland. Cheap ingredients for top dollar price in Nicaragua? I dont mind spending $120.00 dining at Mastros Steak house for quality food. Never again. Not worth going here. Don't waste your time. Much better restaurants in La Calzada to dine at.
Very over priced!!!!!! The last time I went, the wine tasted like dirty socks, I paid and left it on the bar!!!!
The steaks we had were the best meal we had in Nicaragua.
Romantic environment. Delicious steaks 😛
The pork ribs were dry and lacked flavour. Slow service. Not worth the money on this occasion.
Very fine restaurant. The service is good with English menu. The tenderloin beef is very tender and tasty. I had a table in the back near the garden and it was very enjoyable

Great place for grilled steak, pork , chicken and seafood, I have been here few times already, good service , but the portions of the food was little small, for average of $18 per dish,  I expected they should give a little larger portion, other than that, food are delicious. Don’t miss this place.
